oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-11-04 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 4, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, Pee Wee King and his Golden West Cowboys with vocalists Little Texas Daisy and Lost John, and Ford Rush. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Uncle Dave Macon; Dorris Macon; Pee Wee King; Golden West Cowboys; Ford Rush; Lost John
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: My Old Pal Of Yesterday (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) [continued from part 1] -- George D. Hay talks -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon and Dorris Macon -- I Intend To Make Heaven My Home (Uncle Dave Macon, Dorris Macon) -- George D. Hay introduces the Golden West Cowboys trio -- Just One More Kiss (Golden West Cowboys trio) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- When You And I Were Young, Maggie (Ford Rush) -- George D. Hay introduces Lost John and the Golden West Cowboys -- When It's Peach Picking Time In Georgia (Lost John, Golden West Cowboys) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (George D. Hay) -- Closing statement (David Stone)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Wilkerson, George W., 1895-1954; Fruit Jar Drinkers (Musical group); Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; King, Pee Wee, 1914-2000; Golden West Cowboys (Musical group); Little Texas Daisy; Lost John Miller
